channel.title: Comments on: Removing spaces from columns in cfspreadsheet (or any query)
channel.description: Web development notes and commentary from Ryan Stille

item.title: By: Ryan
item.dc:creator: Ryan
item.description: Sunisa that is a good tip, thank you. If you are working with a predictable order of columns that would work well.
item.content:encoded: Sunisa that is a good tip, thank you. If you are working with a predictable order of columns that would work well.

item.title: By: Sunisa
item.dc:creator: Sunisa
item.description: To easily refer to QoQ from cfspreadsheet query, you could remove the 'headerrow' attribute. The query will then refer the 1st column name as 'col_1', 2nd as 'col_2' ...as default. You could use these default column names in your QoQ without worrying the actual column name with space or without spaces.
item.content:encoded: To easily refer to QoQ from cfspreadsheet query, you could remove the ‘headerrow’ attribute. The query will then refer the 1st column name as ‘col_1’, 2nd as ‘col_2’ …as default. You could use these default column names in your QoQ without worrying the actual column name with space or without spaces.
